name: Dance sequins
description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

key_work.title: Larger than life
key_work.brief_description: Two iconic Australian films. Two iconic Australian costumes.

constellations_primary.name: Dance sequins
constellations_primary.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

start.title: Strictly Ballroom
start.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Tristram Miall and New South Wales Film & Television Office
start.brief_description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the establishment by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but their scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

end.title: Strictly Come Dancing
end.brief_description: A dance competition where celebrities compete to be crowned the winner. Who is kicked out of the competition each week is decided by the judges scores and viewer votes. Are today’s celebrities fleet of foot or do they have two left feet?

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: When the long-running BBC show Come Dancing relaunched in 2004, the word ‘Strictly’ was added, as a reference to Strictly Ballroom, to give it a competitive edge.

start.title: Strictly Come Dancing
start.brief_description: A dance competition where celebrities compete to be crowned the winner. Who is kicked out of the competition each week is decided by the judges scores and viewer votes. Are today’s celebrities fleet of foot or do they have two left feet?

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

end.title: On the Beach
end.brief_description: In 1964, atomic war wipes out humanity in the northern hemisphere; one American submarine finds temporary safe haven in Australia, where life-as-usual covers growing despair.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: Strictly host Bruce Forsythe was inspired to start dancing aged 8, when he saw a Fred Astaire dance film. Astaire would later try to expand his reputation beyond the dance films that made him famous by appearing in dramas like On The Beach.

start.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
start.brief_description: Three New York drag queens gets stranded in small town America on their way to a Hollywood beauty pageant. While waiting for parts, the flamboyant trio shows local homophobes their humanity.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

end.title: Romeo + Juliet
end.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Gabriella Martinelli, Philip Martin Brown, Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Martin and Martin Brown
end.brief_description: In director Baz Luhrmann’s contemporary take on William Shakespeare’s classic tragedy, the Montagues and Capulets have moved their ongoing feud to the sweltering suburb of Verona Beach, where Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly wed. Though the film is visually modern, the bard’s dialogue remains.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: In the 90s John Leguizamo had a wide array of roles, playing to and against type in such films as Romeo + Juliet, To Wong Foo, and the ill-fated Super Mario Bros movie.

start.title: Romeo + Juliet
start.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Gabriella Martinelli, Philip Martin Brown, Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Martin and Martin Brown
start.brief_description: In director Baz Luhrmann’s contemporary take on William Shakespeare’s classic tragedy, the Montagues and Capulets have moved their ongoing feud to the sweltering suburb of Verona Beach, where Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly wed. Though the film is visually modern, the bard’s dialogue remains.

constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

end.title: Strictly Ballroom
end.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Tristram Miall and New South Wales Film & Television Office
end.brief_description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the establishment by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but their scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: Strictly Ballroom was the big break for director Baz Lurhmann and costume designer Catherine Martin. It became the first in the ‘Red Curtain Trilogy’, their next two collaborations Romeo + Juliet and Moulin Rouge completing the trilogy.

start.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
start.creator_credit: Latent Image, Specific Films, Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn and Stephan Elliott
start.brief_description: When drag queen Anthony (Hugo Weaving) takes his act on the road with fellow cross-dresser Adam (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp). In their colorful bus, Priscilla, the three performers travel across the Australian desert performing for enthusiastic crowds and homophobic locals.

constellations_primary.name: Joy of drag
constellations_primary.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Gender transcending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

constellations_other.name: Hiding in plain sight
constellations_other.description: This print of upside-down heads is an early optical illusion featuring hidden characters. Movie studios have continued the tradition of playing with perspective in the bold designs, vivid colours and hidden meanings of film posters.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

recommendations.quote: The film's three leads have all swapped fabulous frocks for villainous outfits in superhero films. Terrance Stamp was Zod in Superman 2, Hugo Weaving was Red Skull in Captain America: The First Avenger and Guy Pearce was Aldrich Killian in Iron Man 3.

end.title: Strictly Ballroom
end.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Tristram Miall and New South Wales Film & Television Office
end.brief_description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the establishment by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but their scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: Bill Hunter, who plays Barry Fife in Strictly Ballroom, also appears in Priscilla. These two films, along with Muriel’s Wedding (which also features Hunter) are key films in the early ‘90s Australian film scene, known collectively by critics as ‘The Glitter Cycle’.

start.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
start.creator_credit: Latent Image, Specific Films, Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn and Stephan Elliott
start.brief_description: When drag queen Anthony (Hugo Weaving) takes his act on the road with fellow cross-dresser Adam (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp). In their colorful bus, Priscilla, the three performers travel across the Australian desert performing for enthusiastic crowds and homophobic locals.

constellations_primary.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Gender transcending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

end.brief_description: Three New York drag queens gets stranded in small town America on their way to a Hollywood beauty pageant. While waiting for parts, the flamboyant trio shows local homophobes their humanity.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: Priscilla and To Wong Foo have suspiciously similar plots - three drag queens are on a road trip when their vehicle breaks down - but remarkably there was no plagiarism. To Wong Foo was well into production in 1994 when Priscilla was released.

start.title: On the Beach
start.brief_description: In 1964, atomic war wipes out humanity in the northern hemisphere; one American submarine finds temporary safe haven in Australia, where life-as-usual covers growing despair.

constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

end.brief_description: When drag queen Anthony (Hugo Weaving) takes his act on the road with fellow cross-dresser Adam (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp). In their colorful bus, Priscilla, the three performers travel across the Australian desert performing for enthusiastic crowds and homophobic locals.

constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

recommendations.quote: The film's three leads have all swapped fabulous frocks for villainous outfits in superhero films. Terrance Stamp was Zod in Superman 2, Hugo Weaving was Red Skull in Captain America: The First Avenger and Guy Pearce was Aldrich Killian in Iron Man 3.

links.description: Bill Hunter, who plays bus driver Bob in Priscilla, was inspired to start acting when he was an extra in On The Beach. Legend has it he saw one of the leads need 27 takes to get a line right, and decided he could probably do it better.

links.description: The Larger than life display features Bill Hunter’s jacket from Strictly Ballroom, alongside the famous Wattle Dress from Priscilla.
